treatment.description: Bulb scales: large 1–12; small 0–2. Stem 1.5–4.5 dm. Leaves 3–10, alternate, clustered near ground, 6–15 cm; blade elliptic to obovate-oblong. Flowers nodding, not noticeably fragrant; tepals pinkish purple, obovate, 2–3.5 cm, apex rounded to acute, not recurved; nectaries lavender, narrowly linear, 2/3 tepal length; style unbranched. Capsules obtusely angled. 2n = 24.
treatment.discussion: Fritillaria pluriflora is considered rare and endangered in California and is in cultivation.

references.reference: Witzman, J. A. 1991. The Biology of Fritillaria pluriflora (Liliaceae): A Rare Endemic of the California Flora. M.S. thesis. California State University, Chico.
